titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Eugene Mack Friedl Rice Institute photographs and ephemera, 1938-1942 UA 439
titlestmt.author: Norie Guthrie

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center in the mini-UA collections.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-06-17 09:53:38 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Eugene Mack Friedl photographs and ephemera
did.abstract: This collection consists of photographs and ephmera collected by Eugene Mack Friedl while attending the Rice Institute.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Eugene Mack Friedl born November 21, 1920 matriculated to the Rice Institute in 1938 and graduated with a Electrical Engineering degree in 1942. He went on to obtain a Master's degree in Latin American Studies from the University of Mexico City. After graduation he went on to work for the Internatinal Division of General Electric living in various location in the U.S. and Europe. He died in Saratoga, CA on May 3, 2013.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains photographs, ephmera, an obituary, and a digitized photogram. The photographs chronicle life around the campus including slime parades and football games.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research. Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center in the mini-UA collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Eugene Mack Friedl photographs and ephemera, 1938-1942, MS 648, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from this material must be obtained from the Woodson Reserach Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains: photograhs of slime initiations aka freshmen hazing, football games, students hanging out, the Rice Engineering Show, and Rice Institute buildings; ephemera includes two tickets to Collegiate Night at the Rice Hotel and The Lone Star Press business card; Eugene Mack Friedl's funeral program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contents include: Master tiff and access jpgs contain images related to the life of Eugene Mack Friedl.
